Instruction: In a large bowl, combine the soy sauce, white vinegar, water, minced garlic, bay leaves, whole black peppercorns, and brown sugar. Mix well to dissolve the sugar.
Add the chicken thighs to the marinade and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight for best flavor.
After marinating, remove the chicken thighs from the marinade and pat them dry with paper towels.
In a large skillet or pan, heat the cooking oil over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the chicken thighs in a single layer, skin side down.
Cook the chicken thighs for about 5-6 minutes on each side, or until they are nicely browned and crispy.
Pour the marinade mixture over the browned chicken thighs in the skillet. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet.
Simmer the chicken thighs in the marinade for about 30-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender, and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Once done, remove the bay leaves from the sauce and discard them.
Serve the chicken adobo hot with steamed rice and your favorite side dishes. Enjoy your delicious Filipino-style chicken adobo!
